info.description: A number of configured properties can be retrieved from the "config" endpoints. If enabled, the "job" endpoints allow the retrieval of job details, as well as submitting a new job. "Operation" endpoints include information on available ops, individual ops, and execution of ops. "Properties" endpoints expose the application-specific properties. The "status" endpoint returns information regarding the current status of the service.

get.summary: Gets the Graph description

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets available element generators
get.description: Returns a list of the fully qualified class paths of the elementGenerators available.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets available filter functions
get.description: Returns (in no particular order) the complete list of fully qualified classpaths, of filtering functions that are available to the user.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets available filter functions for the given input class
get.description: Returns a list of the fully qualified classpaths of all filter functions that are applicable to the queried input class.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets the Graph Id

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets available object generators
get.description: Returns a list of the fully qualified class paths of the objectGenerators available.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets the schema
get.description: Returns the full schema for the Store, which should outline the entire list of Elements to be stored in the Graph.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets all serialised fields for a given java class
get.description: Provides a map of all serialised (ie, not to be ignored) fields, for a given class, alongside information related to the expected type of the class.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the Java class, for which the serialised fields should be retrieved

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets all serialised fields and their class type, for a given java class

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets all supported store traits
get.description: Returns a list of traits that the current store can support, such as different types of Aggregation and Filtering.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets available transform functions
get.description: Returns a list of the fully qualified classpaths of all available transform functions, in no particular order.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Get the details of all jobs
get.description: While any Jobs are running, you can check the status of them all using this endpoint.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

503.description: The job service is not available

post.summary: Submits the given operation job to the graph
post.description: A Job essentially runs an OperationChain (OpChain) asynchronously, and caches the results. This endpoint submits a provided Operation or OpChain to the graph for execution, as a Job. This can be useful if an OpChain takes a long time to return results, or you'd like the results to be stored. One small difference is that a JobDetail is returned rather than the results directly, but they can be extracted with the GetJobResults Operation/Endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The operation job to be submitted to the graph

201.description: A new job was successfully submitted

403.description: The current user cannot perform the requested operation

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

501.description: The requested operation is not supported by the target store

503.description: The job service is not available

post.summary: Performs the given scheduled operation chain job on the graph

201.description: A new job was successfully submitted

403.description: The current user cannot perform the requested operation

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

501.description: The requested operation is not supported by the target store

503.description: The job service is not available

get.summary: Get the details of a job
get.description: This endpoint is useful for checking the details of a singular Job, given its Job ID. This shows information such as the current status, the user who executed the Job, startTime etc.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id, for which the details should be returned

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

503.description: The job service is not available

get.summary: Get the results of a job
get.description: Once a Job has FINISHED, this endpoint will extract the results, and display them as one would expect from running an Operation/OpChain.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id, for which the results should be returned

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

503.description: The job service is not available

get.summary: Gets all operations supported by the store
get.description: This endpoint returns a list of the fully qualified classpaths, for all operations supported by the store.

get.summary: Returns a List containing OperationDetails for all supported operations on the graph

post.summary: Performs the given operation on the graph
post.description: Attempts to execute the provided operation on the graph, and returns the result below. Simple examples for each operation can be added using the drop-down below.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The operation to be performed on the graph

403.description: The current user cannot perform the requested operation

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

501.description: The requested operation is not supported by the target store

post.summary: Performs the given operation on the graph, returning a chunked output
post.description: WARNING - This does not work in Swagger.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The operation to be performed, returning a chunked output

403.description: The current user cannot perform the requested operation

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

501.description: The requested operation is not supported by the target store

get.summary: Gets details about the specified operation class
get.description: This endpoint exposes the fields (and whether or not they are required); a list of all possible Operations that could follow it; and a small example in JSON, which includes the queried Operation class.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The fully qualified class name, for which details should be returned

403.description: The current user cannot perform the requested operation

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets example JSON for the specified operation class
get.description: Returns a fully justified and formatted JSON example of the given Operation, containing a few Operations for demonstration and usage purposes.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The fully qualified class name, for which a formatted JSON example should be returned

403.description: The current user cannot perform the requested operation

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets all the compatible operations which could follow the provided operation
get.description: Returns a complete list of all possible compatible operations, that could follow the queried Operation in an OperationChain.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The fully qualified class name, for which all possible compatible follow-up operations should be returned

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Returns the status of the service
get.description: A simple way to check the current status of the application/service.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets all available properties
get.description: Retrieves all properties associated with the application, eg. the app title, or the logo hyperlink.

500.description: Something went wrong in the server

get.summary: Gets the property value for the specified property name
get.description: Retrieves the value of the provided system property.

parameters.name: propertyName
parameters.description: The property name for which the value should be retrieved

500.description: Something went wrong in the server
